title: Vinay Pandya
text:
Software Engineer with 3+ years of experience building scalable web applications and machine learning solutions. I specialize in end-to-end systems using Java, Python, and modern frameworks, with expertise in cloud deployment, data engineering, and ML implementation.
MS Computer Science from San Jose State University. Based in San Francisco, CA.

Tech: Python, Java, TypeScript, PyTorch, AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, FastAPI, React


Featured Projects
Mlx-cluster — Python library for generating random graphs on Apple GPU using mlx-graphs and Metal kernels. 1.2x faster than PyTorch on macOS.
Malware Detection via Opcode Sequences — Master’s thesis using BERT and XLNet to detect malware from disassembled opcodes, achieving 97% accuracy.
View all projects →

title: Vinay Pandya

title: Projects
text:
A Python library for generating and calculating random graphs efficiently on Apple GPU using mlx-graphs and mlx.

Utilized Metal kernels with Python for efficiently calculating random walks and biased random walks, achieving 1.2x performance compared to regular PyTorch kernels on macOS
Used Nanobind, Poetry, and Python Packaging Index (PyPI) for publishing the package

Technologies: Python, MLX, Metal, Nanobind, Poetry
View on GitHub

title: Projects
section: Malware Detection from Opcode Sequences (Master’s Thesis)
text:
Malware Detection from Opcode Sequences (Master’s Thesis)
Created a malware detection algorithm that can detect malware by disassembling opcode sequences.

Utilized BERT and XLNet architectures and various ensemble methods to improve accuracy from 95% to 97%
Novel approach using NLP techniques for cybersecurity applications

Technologies: Python, PyTorch, BERT, XLNet, Transformers

title: Projects
section: Identifying Illicit Transactions in Elliptic Bitcoin Network
text:
Identifying Illicit Transactions in Elliptic Bitcoin Network
Applied Graph Neural Networks to identify illicit nodes in blockchain transaction graphs.

Utilized PyTorch and Torch Geometric GNN paradigms achieving an accuracy of 96%
Used Spectral graph theory, Graph Neural Networks, and Cosmograph for visualization
Implemented GNN Explainer to create explanations for machine learning predictions

Technologies: PyTorch, Torch Geometric, Sklearn, Pandas, Matplotlib, GNN Explainer

title: Welcome to My Blog

title: Welcome to My Blog
text:
What to Expect
I plan to write about:

Machine Learning: Deep dives into ML concepts, especially Graph Neural Networks and NLP
Software Engineering: Best practices, system design, and cloud architecture
Open Source: Updates on my open source projects like mlx-cluster
Career: Insights from working at companies like Amazon and Illumio

Stay tuned for more content!

title: Professional Experience
text:
Software Development Engineer
Amazon | Aug 2022 - Mar 2025

Deployed ML pipelines with NLP and Transformers for Alexa on SageMaker, improving data transcription automation from 15% to 20%
Built GDPR-compliant data pipelines using AWS Glue and SQL for Amazon’s A/B testing platforms
Engineered scalable model serving infrastructure using AWS Step Functions, DynamoDB, and Lambda, processing 100K+ daily requests with 99.9% uptime
Built SageMaker Studio extension integrating Hugging Face and Papers with Code, reducing dataset access time from 90 to 2 days through automated validation and caching
Implemented RAG system using AWS Bedrock and vector databases for Amazon Payments onboarding, reducing onboarding time by 30%

Technologies: Python, AWS SageMaker, AWS Glue, Step Functions, DynamoDB, Lambda, Bedrock, Hugging Face

title: Professional Experience

Created monitoring dashboards using Splunk and AWS CloudWatch to track business KPIs, improving financial visibility by 10%

Technologies: Node.js, Firebase, PagerDuty, Splunk, AWS CloudWatch
